ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.5_0: The training rule on wishing to go to the instruction
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.2_0: At that time the nuns did not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.3_0: But the monks complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.4_0: “How can the nuns not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns don’t do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.8_0: “... How can the nuns not do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.10_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1_0: ‘Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1_1: If she goes beyond a half-month, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4_0: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.5_0: The instruction to give you the instruction:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.7_0: If she thinks, “I won’t enquire about the observance day, nor ask for the instruction,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.10_0: if she searches for a companion nun, but is unable to find one;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.14_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.15_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on nine, is finished.
